p.img: An impressive 114 of Mrs. Damar’s math students competed in the Noetic Learning Math Contest, which is a national elementary math problem solving contest that is held twice a year. 19,367 young mathletes representing 1,279 teams across the country participated in this year’s fall contest.HSA Belmont had SIX team winners and FIVE students that received National Honorable Mention, an honor that is awarded to approximately the top 50% of participants. Team Winners: Jasmine Jones, Dylan Figueredo, Dakota Adams, Selena Ward, Kenya Smith and Martavion Easterling. National Honorable Mention Students: Jasmine Jones, Amya Washington, Iari Figueredo, Dylan Figueredo and Dakari Thomas.

div.p: Horizon Science Academy Belmont is a public charter school serving Kindergarten through eighth grades that opened in 2013. We provide our students with an innovative world class education, rich in math, science and technology. HSA Belmont focuses on preparing students to become bold inquirers, problem solvers and ethical leaders, with skills ready to meet the challenges of a competitive global workforce.

p.span: A man named Nelson Mandela once said “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world”. I’ve always told my mom that I wanted to be sitting in the supreme court one day and she told be that the only way I will sit in that chair is if I take my education seriously and to focus mainly on school, and here at Belmont, that’s exactly what they do! We have amazing teachers that help us achieve our goals in whatever we love to do. That’s what makes H.S.A unique. The love and care we all have for each other as a school family is priceless. So when I hear the question, “Did HSA Belmont help you achieve your success?”, the answer will always be YES!

I was a shy kid until my teachers here showed me to be confident in what I’m saying. My school does a lot to make sure our learning environment has what it takes to make us want to learn by always making sure that we are learning but also having fun doing it. The teachers here are fun but they also make sure we’re learning in order to achieve. The teachers will also make you want to come here because they allow you to join a certain classes that you like doing. For example, we get to choose our own special classes depending on our likes! I think that my school really believes that we should succeed in life and focus on what we need to accomplish and that’s what I learned here at Horizon is to never give up on life and yourself. This is what my school does to the environment and makes us want to learn. They inspire us.

Horizon Science Academy Belmont made me love myself as a person because they charge my batteries with enthusiasm, hope and make me want to be a better person and to keep being a dedicated student. No matter where I go, I will be thankful and I will say “I am what I am because of my family, God and my amazing school, Horizon Science Academy Belmont.

div.p: I send her to HSA Belmont and I think it’s the best. I sent her to other schools and was dissatisfied. Since she has been here, she has soared like an eagle! She’s been here four years.

This is their third year attending. I send them to Belmont for the awesome education they are receiving, the commitment from the teachersand the parants, and their personal touch! The office staff are just wonderful! Overall HSA Belmont is just the place to send your child!

I chose HSA Belmont so that he would have a better chance than he would have in other schools. I attended a public school myself , but instead of them taking their time with me because I needed special attention, they just passed my through. I wanted him to have a different experience.
